channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The traffic signal facing Elm Road on the far side of the junction is not facing the oncoming traffic., 21st February
item.description:
When approaching the cross roads of Elm Road / Station Road, High Street and Main road from Elm road the traffic signal on the corner of Station Road and High Street is not facing the oncoming traffic from Elm Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 87, Main Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parking in electric bays whilst visiting mosque, 21st February
item.description:
Non-electric cars keep parking in the electric bays whilst using the mosque. Please can you check on this area? I’m electrical electric car user and then can’t charge the car and I’ve also bought a permit for this.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cresset Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The traffic light on Regis Rd intended to face Leighton Rd, 21st February
item.description:
The traffic light intended for vehicles on Leighton Road is incorrectly oriented. It is currently facing Kentish Town Road (southbound), which may result in drivers receiving incorrect signals.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kentish Town Road, Kentish Town, Greater London

item.title: Potholes on Laird Avenue, 21st February
item.description:
Hi I am writing to formally report serious road surface deterioration on [Laird Avenue, RM16 2NL]. This week, speed bumps were installed; however, the surrounding carriageway has not been repaired. There are multiple potholes around the new traffic calming measures, and the overall road surface is significantly damaged. The defects are causing vehicles to slow abruptly and swerve to avoid damage, particularly near the speed bumps. This is creating a safety hazard for drivers, cyclists, and pedestrians. Given that new traffic calming measures have just been installed, it is concerning that the existing surface defects were not addressed at the same time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Laird Avenue, Little Thurrock, Grays
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Aments falling onto pavement and driveway, roots lifting pavement, 21st February
item.description:
Tree roots are lifting the pavement and cracking the asphalt, and there are excessive aments falling onto the pavement. Problem has been present for the last 2 weeks, between 168 and 170 Clock House Road. Pavement requires a little sweep.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Reoccurring Human Faeces, 21st February
item.description:
Over the past two weekends, Stanborough Passage, has repeatedly been used as a public urinal. There have also been four instances of defecation. This is a serious health concern and needs prompt clean up and preventative measures.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
